intro: Drymoglossum ellipticum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often slightly curled at the edges. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The leaves are usually a dark green color and have a smooth, glossy surface. It plays an important role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms in its ecosystem.
